meanings.definition: A large-scale downwarping of the Earth's crust.
meanings.sent1: The geosyncline formed a deep valley in the Earth's crust.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the geosyncline to understand the Earth's geological processes.
meanings.sent3: The geosyncline decided to take a nap and caused a big dip in the ground.
meanings.sent4: The geosyncline was like a giant hand pressing down on the Earth's surface.
meanings.sent5: The geosyncline's movement reshaped the landscape over millions of years.

meanings.definition: A linear trough in the Earth's crust in which sediment accumulates.
meanings.sent1: The geosyncline collected layers of sediment over time.
meanings.sent2: Rocks from the mountains eroded and filled the geosyncline with debris.
meanings.sent3: The geosyncline was so full of sediment, it couldn't hold any more dirt!
meanings.sent4: The geosyncline became a treasure trove of ancient fossils buried in its depths.
meanings.sent5: Explorers discovered valuable minerals in the geosyncline's sedimentary layers.
